result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kera D. Skibba was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Kera D. Skibba was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons while on probation.

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

*Take prescribed medications as prescribed from a physician
*Obtain all prescriptions from one pharmacy 
*Sign all necessary releases so agent can verify compliance 
*Participate in any counseling, treatment or assessments as  recommended by the agent.
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  D Lettau or R Christensen, their residences or places of employment 
*Provide DNA sample, if not already done so

Defendant Kera D. Skibba n/k/a Larson in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today for sentencing are 15CF252, 16CF177, 16CF337 and 14CM374 and for a plea/sentencing is 14CF353.  All charges in 15CF253 and 16CF185 were DRI.

2:12 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State indicates that an amended information had been filed. 
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF353 (State files an amended information for Count 1):
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest 
Count 3 (PAC .292) - Dismissed 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2 on 14CF353 and Count 3 is dismissed.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification.  Atty Knaapen indicates it is uncertain as to what case the victim is associated with.
Atty Sheets would ask that the Court disregard the letter from the "victim" as a victim impact statement.
The Court has reviewed the letter from Ms Anderson and makes statements on the record.
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
3:08 p.m.  Court is in a 5 minute recess.
3:14 p.m.  Court is back in session.
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF252:
Count 1 -
Withhold entry of judgment 
**If defendant successfully completes probation, Count 1 will be dismissed 
**If defendant is revoked from probation, judgment of conviction would be entered on Count 1 and the defendant would return to court for sentencing on that count 
**Granted 6 days of jail credit if judgment is entered 

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay 6 month jail sentence - concurrent 
Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent with other probations 
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 of 14CF353
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge 

Count 5 -

Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent with other probations 
**Conditions of Probation:

Pay costs

**If the defendant is revoked, judgment of conviction would be entered on this  count and the defendant would return to court for sentencing

16CF337:

*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on February 22, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Kera D. Skibba in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF353, 15CF252, 15CF253, 16CF177, 16CF185, 16CF337 & 14CM374.

11:39 a.m.  Atty Knaapen calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Knaapen indicates that the sentencing will take place at a later date but plea's are to be entered on all cases, except 14CF353. 
Atty Knaapen states partial plea agreement on the record.
Atty Sheets states that the agreement stated by Atty Knaapen is a correct statement.
Court requests that the parties provide written statement on what the sentencing agreement stated on the record is.
Atty Sheets makes additional statements.
Atty Sheets waives reading of the amended information(s) provided by the State.
BTC:  Not Guilty plea's are entered on 14CF353 in regards to  the amended information.
Atty Sheets makes a statement that he has met with his client and reviewed each and every plea questionnaire.
Atty Sheets clarifies for the Court that the parties have agreed to defer judgment on Count 1 of 16CF337, Count 1 of 16CF177 and Count 1 of 15CF252.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF353 - PLEA TO BE DONE AT THE TIME OF THE SENTENCING HEARING
Amended information provided by the State

Count 2 -
Count 3 -

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

BY THE COURT:
Parties will need to set a sentencing hearing with the Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.

Plea hearing on January 20, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Kera D. Skibba in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF353, 15CF252, 15CF253, 16CF177, 16CF185, 16CF337 and 14CM374.

2:36  p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Knaapen indicates that there had been a plea agreement but there are some medical concerns of the defendant and they will be requesting and adjournment.
Atty Sheets makes statements that his client is in a high risk pregnancy and would request an adjournment of these cases.
Court would request a letter from a physician and makes further statements.
Court would like this case re-scheduled for a plea hearing.

BY THE COURT:
